summary: This document is an email chain from May 28, 2020, between US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing scheduling a meeting about the Epstein probate case. It includes forwarded updates from February 2020 detailing a dispute between Epstein's estate executors and the Virgin Islands Attorney General over victim compensation and asset liens.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: US Attorney for the Southern District of New York; recipient and participant in email chain discussing scheduling a Webex meeting about the Epstein probate case.

persons.name: Denise George
persons.context: Attorney General of the US Virgin Islands who brought charges against Epstein's estate, alleged fraud by his lawyers/executors, and placed liens on estate assets, impeding the victim compensation fund.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Named by Epstein as an executor of his will; alleged by Virgin Islands AG to have potentially been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Named by Epstein as an executor of his will; alleged by Virgin Islands AG to have potentially been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Bennet Moskowitz
persons.context: Representing Epstein's estate in court; claimed Virgin Islands AG's liens prevent releasing money for the victim compensation fund.

persons.name: Ken Feinberg
persons.context: Settlement expert proposed to oversee a voluntary resolution program for Epstein's accusers; known for handling 9/11, Catholic church abuse, and BP oil spill claims.

persons.name: Edward Helmore
persons.context: Author of The Guardian article about the dispute between Epstein's estate and the Virgin Islands Attorney General.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier whose estate is the subject of the probate proceedings, victim compensation disputes, and ongoing investigations.

connections.description: Epstein named Indyke as an executor of his will; Indyke served as his lawyer.
Epstein named Kahn as an executor of his will; Kahn served as his lawyer.
Both named as executors and alleged by Virgin Islands AG Denise George to have potentially been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.
Moskowitz is representing Epstein's estate, of which Indyke is an executor.
Moskowitz is representing Epstein's estate, of which Kahn is an executor.
George, as Virgin Islands AG, brought charges against the estate and alleged Indyke's potential complicity in fraud.
George, as Virgin Islands AG, brought charges against the estate and alleged Kahn's potential complicity in fraud.
Feinberg was proposed to administer the victim compensation program for Epstein's accusers.

events.title: SDNY Scheduling Meeting on Epstein Probate
events.description: US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York personnel email to schedule a Webex meeting to discuss concrete litigation planning with Epstein's estate.

events.title: Guardian Reports on Epstein Estate vs. Virgin Islands AG Dispute
events.description: The Guardian publishes article detailing the legal dispute between Epstein's estate executors and Virgin Islands AG Denise George over victim compensation funds and fraud allegations.

events.title: Virgin Islands AG Brings Charges Against Epstein Estate
events.description: Virgin Islands Attorney General Denise George brings charges against Epstein's estate, alleges his lawyers/executors may have been part of his fraud, and places claims on his two islands.

events.title: Estate Proposes Feinberg-Run Victim Compensation Program
events.description: Epstein's estate asks courts to allow a voluntary resolution program for accusers, to be overseen by settlement expert Ken Feinberg.

events.title: Epstein's Death in Jail
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein found dead by suicide in a Manhattan jail cell.

events.title: Epstein Arrest on Federal Charges
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrested on fresh federal sex trafficking and conspiracy charges.

events.title: Epstein's Florida Plea
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to a Florida state prostitution charge and served a 13-month jail sentence.

keyFacts: The Virgin Islands Attorney General, Denise George, brought charges against Epstein's estate and alleged his lawyers/executors, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.
The Virgin Islands AG placed liens on Epstein's estate assets, including his two islands, freezing bank accounts and impeding the release of funds for a victim compensation program.

Epstein's estate had proposed a victim compensation fund to be administered by Ken Feinberg, but the Virgin Islands AG opposed it, demanding greater accountability, cooperation with investigations, and waiver of NDAs.
Epstein modified his will two days before his death to have it executed in the Caribbean territory, naming Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn as executors.
The US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively planning litigation strategy regarding the Epstein probate case as of May 2020.
